filmography.title: You Can't Take It With You
filmography.role_description: The son of a wealthy banker who falls in love with a woman from an eccentric, free-spirited family, leading to a clash of class and values.
filmography.plot: A man from a family of rich snobs becomes engaged to a woman from a good-natured but decidedly eccentric family.

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A naive and idealistic youth leader appointed to the U.S. Senate who single-handedly fights against deep-seated political corruption using a filibuster.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

filmography.title: Destry Rides Again
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered deputy sheriff who refuses to carry a gun, preferring to use his wits to tame a lawless frontier town.
filmography.plot: A soft-spoken deputy sheriff who doesn't like guns is hired to tame a wild Western town, where he meets a boisterous saloon singer.

filmography.title: The Shop Around the Corner
filmography.role_description: A hardworking gift shop employee in Budapest who constantly bickers with a female co-worker, unaware she is the anonymous pen pal he loves.
filmography.plot: Two employees at a gift shop can barely stand each other, without realizing that they are falling in love through the post as each other's anonymous pen pal.

filmography.title: The Philadelphia Story
filmography.role_description: A cynical tabloid reporter covering a high-society wedding who unexpectedly falls for the bride, challenging his own prejudices about the rich.
filmography.plot: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

filmography.title: The Mortal Storm
filmography.role_description: A German farmer and pacifist who refuses to join the Nazi party, putting him at odds with his friends and society as fascism rises.
filmography.plot: A family in a small German university town is torn apart by the rise of the Nazi party when the father and daughter refuse to conform.

filmography.title: It's a Wonderful Life
filmography.role_description: A compassionate businessman who sacrifices his personal dreams for his community, only to be saved from suicide by an angel showing him the world without him.
filmography.plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

filmography.title: Call Northside 777
filmography.role_description: A cynical Chicago reporter based on a true story who investigates a decade-old murder case, eventually uncovering the innocence of a convicted man.
filmography.plot: A reporter proves a washerwoman's son innocent of the murder of a policeman 11 years after he was imprisoned.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild of America: Win – Best Written American Drama

filmography.title: Rope
filmography.role_description: A shrewd prep school housemaster whose philosophical musings on murder inadvertently inspire two students to commit a crime, which he then unravels.
filmography.plot: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party after strangling their former classmate to death.

filmography.title: The Stratton Story
filmography.role_description: The real-life Major League pitcher who loses his leg in a hunting accident but courageously learns to pitch again with a prosthetic.
filmography.plot: The true story of Chicago White Sox pitcher Monty Stratton, who loses a leg in a hunting accident but fights his way back to professional baseball.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: Winchester '73
filmography.role_description: A hard-edged cowboy who relentlessly pursues an outlaw—his own brother—across the West to retrieve a prize-winning rifle and settle a blood feud.
filmography.plot: A cowboy's obsession with a prize-winning rifle leads him on a chase through the Wild West.

filmography.title: Broken Arrow
filmography.role_description: A former soldier who befriends Apache leader Cochise and marries an Apache woman, working tirelessly to broker peace between settlers and Native Americans.
filmography.plot: Tom Jeffords tries to make peace between settlers and Apaches in the Arizona territory.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: Harvey
filmography.role_description: A gentle, eccentric man whose best friend is a six-foot, three-and-a-half-inch tall invisible rabbit named Harvey, confusing his social-climbing family.
filmography.plot: Due to his insistence that he has an invisible six-foot-tall rabbit for a best friend, a whimsical middle-aged man is thought by his family to be insane.

filmography.title: Bend of the River
filmography.role_description: A former border raider with a dark past who tries to go straight by guiding a wagon train to Oregon, but must violently defend the settlers from betrayal.
filmography.plot: A town-tamer with a past guides a wagon train to Oregon and battles hijackers to ensure the settlers get their food supplies.

filmography.title: The Naked Spur
filmography.role_description: An embittered rancher turned bounty hunter who is driven by greed and vengeance to capture a killer, revealing his own psychological scars.
filmography.plot: A bounty hunter trying to bring a murderer to justice is forced to accept the help of two less-than-trustworthy strangers.

filmography.title: The Glenn Miller Story
filmography.role_description: The legendary big band leader and trombonist whose innovative sound defined an era before his tragic disappearance in WWII.
filmography.plot: A biography of bandleader Glenn Miller from his early days in the music business in 1929 through to his 1944 death.

filmography.title: Rear Window
filmography.role_description: A professional photographer confined to a wheelchair with a broken leg who spies on his neighbors and becomes convinced one has committed murder.
filmography.plot: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his Greenwich Village courtyard apartment window, and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

filmography.title: The Far Country
filmography.role_description: A self-interested cattleman who drives a herd to Dawson during the Gold Rush, initially refusing to help others until he is personally wronged.
filmography.plot: A self-minded adventurer locks horns with a crooked lawman while driving cattle to the Klondike.

filmography.title: Strategic Air Command
filmography.role_description: A professional baseball player and WWII veteran who is recalled to active duty, struggling to balance his love for flying with his family and sports career.
filmography.plot: A baseball star is recalled to military service to fly the new B-36 bomber for the Strategic Air Command.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: The Man from Laramie
filmography.role_description: An ex-army officer who poses as a wagon hauler to find the man who sold guns to the Apaches that killed his brother.
filmography.plot: A stranger defies a local cattle baron and his sadistic son by working for one of their oldest rivals.

filmography.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
filmography.role_description: An American physician vacationing in Morocco who is drawn into an assassination plot when his son is kidnapped to ensure his silence.
filmography.plot: A family vacationing in Morocco accidentally stumbles on to an assassination plot and the conspirators look determined to prevent them from interfering.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Que Sera, Sera')

filmography.title: The Spirit of St. Louis
filmography.role_description: The determined aviator who meticulously plans and executes the first historic non-stop solo flight across the Atlantic Ocean.
filmography.plot: Charles 'Slim' Lindbergh struggles to finance and design an airplane that will make his New York to Paris flight the first solo transatlantic crossing.

filmography.title: Vertigo
filmography.role_description: A former police detective with a paralyzing fear of heights who becomes obsessively infatuated with the mysterious woman he is hired to follow.
filmography.plot: A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.
filmography.awards: Sight & Sound: Voted #1 Greatest Film of All Time (2012)

filmography.title: Bell, Book and Candle
filmography.role_description: A New York publisher who becomes bewitched by his neighbor, a modern-day witch, leading him to fall in love with her under a spell.
filmography.plot: A modern-day witch casts a spell on her neighbor to make him fall in love with her.

filmography.title: Anatomy of a Murder
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but humble small-town lawyer who battles a slick big-city prosecutor while defending an Army lieutenant in a complex murder trial.
filmography.plot: An upstate Michigan lawyer defends a soldier who claims he killed an innkeeper due to 'irresistible impulse' after the man raped his wife.

filmography.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
filmography.role_description: An idealistic young attorney from the East who travels West to bring law and order, but gains fame for a violent act he may not have committed.
filmography.plot: A senator returns to a western town for the funeral of an old friend and tells the story of his origins.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A rugged mountain man and trapper who marries into a pioneer family, helping them settle the frontier.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

filmography.title: Shenandoah
filmography.role_description: A stubborn Virginia farmer who tries to keep his family neutral during the Civil War, until the conflict tragically lands on his doorstep.
filmography.plot: A Virginia farmer refuses to support the Confederacy because he is opposed to slavery, but he will not support the Union because he is deeply opposed to war.

filmography.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
filmography.role_description: A veteran cargo pilot who must lead a group of survivors to build a new plane from the wreckage of their crash in the Sahara desert.
filmography.plot: After a cargo plane crashes in the Sahara desert, the survivors attempt to build a new plane from the wreckage to fly out.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Ian Bannen)

filmography.title: The Shootist
filmography.role_description: A compassionate physician who delivers a terminal cancer diagnosis to a legendary gunfighter, advising him on his final days.
filmography.plot: A dying gunfighter spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum of pain and a maximum of dignity.
